com.lucaslouca.util

Class LLTownMapImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lucaslouca.util.LLTownMapImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LLTownMap

    public class LLTownMapImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements LLTownMap
    The LLTownMapImpl class implements the LLTownMap interface.

    LLTownMapImpl is a map that stores towns using a LLDirectedGraph underneath.

    It wraps the functionality of LLDirectedGraph and provides methods for accessing it using the town names.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LLTownMapImpl.NoSuchRouteException
      Exception that is thrown when a provided route is not valid because a town or road to that town does not exist.

    • Method Detail

      • parseInput

        public void parseInput(java.lang.String input)
        Parse input of the format XYN representing a route between two towns X and Y, with:

        X is a single character.

        Y is a single character.

        N (optional) is an integer >= 0, representing the distance between X and Y.

        Specified by:
        parseInput in interface LLTownMap
        Parameters:
        input - line input to parse.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not in the above described format.

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String path)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Initialise map from a text file at path. Each line in the file is of format XYN representing a route between two towns X and Y, with:

        X is a single character.

        Y is a single character.

        N (optional) is an integer >= 0, representing the distance between X and Y.

        Sample File content:

        AB5
        BC4
        CD8
        DC8
        DE6
        AD5
        CE2
        EB3
        AE7

        Specified by:
        init in interface LLTownMap
        Parameters:
        path - absolute path to the input file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found at given path.

        public java.lang.String shortestPathBetween(java.lang.String start,
                                            java.lang.String dest)
                                     throws LLTownMapImpl.NoSuchRouteException
        String representing the shortest path between start and dest.
        Specified by:
        shortestPathBetween in interface LLTownMap
        Parameters:
        start - name of start town.
        dest - name of town which we want to reach.
        Returns:
        String representing the shortest path between start and dest.
        Throws:
        LLTownMapImpl.NoSuchRouteException - if no route exists between the two towns.
